ygData.msgSnippet: The RegexRule might work for you. There s an example of its use in the user manual: http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual/config.html#submodules If

The RegexRule might work for you. There's an example of its use in the 
user manual:

   http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual/config.html#submodules

If not, you'd have to dive into the code and write your own URI 
canonicalization rule class.

- Gordon @ IA


mr jones wrote:
>   Hi folks,
> 
> How do I create a Query Normaliser within uri-canonicalization rule to function as a 'search and replace'. 
>   So for example convert: /news/index.asp?id=11 to: /news/print.asp?id=11  but leave /news/index.php?tableofcontents=true as it is.
>   Cheers
>   Jason
